intro: Metteniusa edulis, commonly known as the edible metteniusa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture. While not widely cultivated, it is occasionally used in local traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions.
